section.simpara: Sends an arbitrary event to the manager interface.
section.para: Sends an event of your choosing to the manager interface. The resulting event packet has the following format:Event: UserEvent eventname Channel: channelname Uniqueid: call-identifier [body]
section.simpara: Additional lines in the form fieldname: value may be specified in the body. Multiple lines are separated with the "|" ('pipe') character (in older versions of Asterisk, with "," or "^") getrennt.
section.programlisting: exten => 123,1,UserEvent(Test,Note: I am calling ${XY} now.) exten => 123,n,Dial(${XY})

formalpara.title: Internal help for this application in Asterisk 1.4:

para.screen:
-= Info about application 'UserEvent' =-
[Synopsis] Send an arbitrary event to the manager interface
[Description] UserEvent(eventname[|body]): Sends an arbitrary event to the manager interface, with an optional body representing additional arguments. The body may be specified as a | delimeted list of headers. Each additional argument will be placed on a new line in the event. The format of the event will be: Event: UserEvent UserEvent: <specified event name> [body] If no body is specified, only Event and UserEvent headers will be present.
